citation.article-title: Sporomusa paucivorans sp. nov., a methylotrophic bacterium that forms acetic acid from hydrogen and carbon dioxide.

p.s: Description of Sporomusa paucivorans sp. nov.
Sporomusa paucivorans (pauca L. n. adj., a few; L. v. voro, to devour; paucivorans, referring to the fact that the strain metabolizes a more restricted range of substrates than other Sporomusa
Curved rods with laterally inserted flagella; gram-negative staining; spore formation not observed; does not tolerate 70Â°C for 15 min.
Strict anaerobe; catalase negative; growth on H2-CO2, methanol, and formate; growth on substrates with odd carbon numbers.
On all these substrates, acetate is the only product formed.
Primary mono-alcohols with more than two carbons are metabolized into the corresponding fatty acid plus acetic acid.
Does not reduce sulfate but reduces sulfur.
G+C content of the DNA is 47.1 mol%.
Has been found in lake sediment.
